title: What should the government do about taxation?

choices.A: Reduce taxes, the government already takes too much money away from hard-working individuals.
choices.C: Taxation should be based on carbon footprint.
choices.D: Stay out of it, the government has caused enough damage already.

title: What is your stance on healthcare?

choices.B: Expand public healthcare options for all.
choices.C: Promote healthcare reforms based on environmental impact.

title: What is your opinion on gun control?

choices.A: Protect the Second Amendment and gun ownership rights.
choices.B: Implement stricter background checks and gun control laws.
choices.C: Ban certain firearms to reduce violence.
choices.D: Allow states to decide their own policies on gun control.

title: How should the government address climate change?

choices.A: Focus on innovation and clean energy investments without harming businesses.
choices.C: Advocate for global initiatives like the Paris Agreement.
choices.D: Let the free market handle climate change solutions.

title: What is your view on immigration policies?

choices.A: Strengthen border security and enforce immigration laws.
choices.B: Provide pathways to citizenship for undocumented immigrants.
choices.C: Focus on humanitarian approaches to asylum seekers.
choices.D: Reduce government interference and let communities handle immigration issues.

title: How should education be managed in the U.S.?

choices.A: Promote school choice and charter schools.
choices.B: Increase funding for public schools and educators.
choices.C: Integrate environmental education into school curriculums.
choices.D: Allow parents and local communities to decide education policies.

title: What is your stance on economic policies?

choices.A: Support free-market principles and reduce regulations.
choices.B: Increase minimum wage and support labor unions.
choices.C: Focus on sustainability and green economic initiatives.
choices.D: Limit government intervention and promote entrepreneurial growth.

title: What is your view on government spending?

choices.A: Focus on reducing the national debt and cutting unnecessary programs.
choices.B: Increase spending on social welfare programs.
choices.C: Prioritize spending on environmental initiatives and renewable energy.
choices.D: Limit government spending and encourage private sector solutions.

title: What is your opinion on national security?

choices.A: Strengthen the military and increase defense budgets.
choices.B: Focus on diplomacy and reduce military spending.
choices.C: Address national security through global cooperation on climate and resource management.
choices.D: Minimize government control and allow local communities to manage safety.

title: How should the government handle criminal justice reform?

choices.A: Enforce stricter laws and support law enforcement.
choices.B: Focus on rehabilitation and reducing incarceration rates.
choices.C: Address systemic issues like environmental justice in affected communities.
choices.D: Limit government involvement and allow communities to create solutions.
